dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double jeopardy doesn't apply! We bring a new charge - of homicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy - what happened to you, on the helicopter - we don't even know if we could prove -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No: he shot her and she died. The fact that it took time - the fact that he went to trial in between, just for shooting her - doesn't matter. He fired a gun and caused her death, and that's murder. (Beat) If he can twist the law around - then so can we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lobruto thinks it out.    Wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second indictment on the same incident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man burns down a house; we charge him with arson. There were people sleeping upstairs - and after weeks in the hospital, they die. We'd charge him with murder. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lobruto nods. On the fence, but seeing it now.         Im with the young man's fervor, and his logic. But he shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All your evidence is still toxic.      The confession, the arrest - it's all still inadmissible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy grimaces.    Looks down.    Thinking, intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Willy. It was a good idea, but -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get something new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy looks up at him.    Calm now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy, you can't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't work for you. (Beat) Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Lobruto sighs, as Willy nods and turns to start bac to the garage. With work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do anything crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else have we got left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the day. Marchand pulls on his coat, shuts down hi computer. He turns to go - - Willy is standing in his doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy follows an EVIDENCE CLERK along an aisle between fl to-ceiling steel shelves of boxes marked with case number

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are from that thing at the courthouse, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clerk stops, checking a number against a slip of pape his hand - pulls down a box for Willy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawford is building a new Rube Goldberg device, tools an parts laid out precisely on a table. Eyes enlarged by the glasses, he silently connects two ti pieces of metal -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - when a French door suddenly implodes, a metal lawn chai hurled in from the backyard smashing through it. Crawford stands, taking off the glasses - - as Willy walks in over the broken glass, carrying Nunal gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very dramatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy crosses the room to the alarm panel on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't seen nothin' yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses the POLICE emergency button, then turns to Crawford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?   You've already got one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the gun you shot your wife with. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawford doesn't move. Willy raises his gun, points it at Crawford's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One way or another, I'm going to see to it you receive justice tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawford studies Willy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious, aren't you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A smile dawning) Willy. You got religion, didn't you?! You care. That's...priceless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs.   Willy keeps the gun aimed at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's very sweet. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna be a whole lot less funny in about a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawford nods.    Considering the game.   Unruffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting it like this: is that going to hold up in court?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't work for the D.A. any more. I'm just a guy who broke into your house. When the police arrest me - they'll inventory anything in my possession. If that happens to be crucial evidence in another case, well: some prosecutor just got lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Crawford studies Willy's eyes, over the muzzle o the gun between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a very special kind of person to look right into someone's eyes and pull the trigger. It takes a unique kind of strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you'd know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy cocks the gun. Crawford shakes his head.    Eyes on Willy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy doesn't lower the gun.    But he doesn't pull the trigger, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?
